meta.title: Develop a Materials and Processing Technology outcome in an authentic context
meta.purpose: Students are able to develop a Materials and Processing Technology outcome in an authentic context.

grade_descriptors.N1: Evidence does not reach the minimum threshold for Achieved-level indicators.
grade_descriptors.N2: Some Achieved-level indicators are met, but not enough to satisfy all required Achieved criteria.
grade_descriptors.A3: All Achieved-level indicators are met; no Merit-level indicator meets the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.A4: All Achieved indicators are met and at least one Merit indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.M5: All Achieved indicators are met and the Merit threshold is reached; no Excellence-level indicator meets the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.M6: All Achieved indicators are met, all Merit indicators are met, and at least one Excellence indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.E7: All Achieved and Merit indicators are met and the Excellence threshold is reached, but not all Excellence indicators are met.
grade_descriptors.E8: All Achieved, Merit, and Excellence indicators are met.

key_terms.definition: Statement identifying purpose, end user, and actual or modelled intended environment for the outcome.
Precise, measurable physical and functional requirements evaluated as met or not met.
Documented first-hand input from more than one knowledgeable person used to inform development.
Real-life situation familiar to students where the outcome will be used in an actual or modelled intended environment.
Extent to which the outcome meets brief and specification requirements for the end user in the actual or modelled intended environment.

omis.description: Creates a tangible outcome for a person, whānau, or community that addresses a brief with specifications.
omis.detection_hint: Outcome must be present and clearly linked to a stated brief with specifications. Drawings or intentions without a finished product do not satisfy this indicator. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “shoe rack used by the family in the hallway”

omis.description: Brief explicitly states purpose, end user, and actual or modelled intended environment.
omis.detection_hint: All three elements must be explicit. A generic context or missing environment detail is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “purpose: organise shoes; end-user: whānau; environment: hallway entrance (modelled)”

omis.description: Physical and functional specifications are precise, measurable, and evaluated as met/not met.
omis.detection_hint: Must include measurable terms (e.g., dimensions, temperature). Simply stating 'good quality' or 'looks nice' is not measurable. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.

omis.description: Outcome is developed and demonstrated within a real-life, familiar situation for the student.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must show use or testing in the stated authentic environment. Studio photos alone are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “final photograph taken in the intended environment familiar to the student”

omis.description: Collects documented, first-hand feedback from more than one stakeholder at more than one stage of development.
omis.detection_hint: Feedback must be documented and first-hand from at least two stakeholders at separate stages. Single survey or single person is inadequate. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “teacher and end-user consulted during trial and final testing”

omis.description: Applies stakeholder feedback to inform specific refinements that improve the outcome’s fitness for purpose.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must link feedback to a clear change (e.g., material, dimension). Listing feedback without showing resulting action does not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “added accessible switch after whānau said button was hard to reach”

omis.description: Explains reasoning behind decisions that improved the outcome’s fitness for purpose.
omis.detection_hint: Must include rationale (why) not just description (what). Statements like “I changed it” without justification are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “chose crunchier pastry so the filling stays contained”

omis.description: Analyses how stakeholder feedback informed the development of the outcome for a person, whānau, or community, referencing trade-offs or priorities.
omis.detection_hint: Must discuss cause-effect of feedback on design choices. Simple statements that feedback was ‘helpful’ are inadequate. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “prioritised ventilation over capacity after whānau stressed damp shoes issue”

omis.description: Critically evaluates the final outcome against the brief and specifications for fitness for purpose in the actual or modelled intended environment, with detailed, quantifiable evidence of specifications being met.
omis.detection_hint: Must reference specific specifications, environment conditions, and measurable data. Generic affirmations are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: “meets weight ≤ 5 kg, fits 600 mm shelf width, withstands 45 °C for 2 h”
omis.source_ref: AS PDF p2 ¶Evaluate; Explanatory Note 2; Low Excellence commentary

change_log: Added ‘person, whānau, or community’ to A1 and E1 for alignment with standard wording.
Replaced ‘intended environment’ with ‘actual or modelled intended environment’ across relevant indicators.
Clarified A3 to explicitly include ‘physical and functional specifications’.
Expanded A4 to include ‘familiar situation for the student’.
Revised M1 to require ‘documented first-hand feedback’.
Merged E2 and E3 into a single comprehensive evaluation indicator.
Adjusted weighting balance to 4:3:3 ratio across levels.
Updated key terms for contextual and definitional precision.
